org.apache.hama.commons.math

Interface DoubleVector

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DenseDoubleVector, NamedDoubleVector, SparseDoubleVector

    public interface DoubleVector
    Vector with doubles. Some of the operations are mutable, unlike the apply and math functions, they return a fresh instance every time.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  DoubleVector.DoubleVectorElement
      Class for iteration of elements, consists of an index and a value at this index.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        double get(int index)
        Retrieves the value at given index.
        Parameters:
        index - the index.
        Returns:
        a double value at the index.

      • getLength

        int getLength()
        Get the length of a vector, for sparse instance it is the actual length. (not the dimension!) Always a constant time operation.
        Returns:
        the length of the vector.

      • getDimension

        int getDimension()
        Get the dimension of a vector, for dense instance it is the same like the length, for sparse instances it is usually not the same. Always a constant time operation.
        Returns:
        the dimension of the vector.

      • set

        void set(int index,
       double value)
        Set a value at the given index.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the vector to set.
        value - the value at the index of the vector to set.

      • applyToElements

        DoubleVector applyToElements(DoubleFunction func)
        Apply a given DoubleVectorFunction to this vector and return a new one.
        Parameters:
        func - the function to apply.
        Returns:
        a new vector with the applied function.

      • applyToElements

        DoubleVector applyToElements(DoubleVector other,
                           DoubleDoubleFunction func)
        Apply a given DoubleDoubleVectorFunction to this vector and the other given vector.
        Parameters:
        other - the other vector.
        func - the function to apply on this and the other vector.
        Returns:
        a new vector with the result of the function of the two vectors.

      • addUnsafe

        DoubleVector addUnsafe(DoubleVector vector)
        Adds the given DoubleVector to this vector.
        Parameters:
        vector - the other vector.
        Returns:
        a new vector with the sum of both vectors at each element index.

      • add

        DoubleVector add(DoubleVector vector)
        Validates the input and adds the given DoubleVector to this vector.
        Parameters:
        vector - the other vector.
        Returns:
        a new vector with the sum of both vectors at each element index.

      • add

        DoubleVector add(double scalar)
        Adds the given scalar to this vector.
        Parameters:
        scalar - the scalar.
        Returns:
        a new vector with the result at each element index.

      • subtractUnsafe

        DoubleVector subtractUnsafe(DoubleVector vector)
        Subtracts this vector by the given DoubleVector.
        Parameters:
        vector - the other vector.
        Returns:
        a new vector with the difference of both vectors.

      • subtract

        DoubleVector subtract(DoubleVector vector)
        Validates the input and subtracts this vector by the given DoubleVector.
        Parameters:
        vector - the other vector.
        Returns:
        a new vector with the difference of both vectors.

      • subtract

        DoubleVector subtract(double scalar)
        Subtracts the given scalar to this vector. (vector - scalar).
        Parameters:
        scalar - the scalar.
        Returns:
        a new vector with the result at each element index.

      • subtractFrom

        DoubleVector subtractFrom(double scalar)
        Subtracts the given scalar from this vector. (scalar - vector).
        Parameters:
        scalar - the scalar.
        Returns:
        a new vector with the result at each element index.

        DoubleVector divide(double scalar)
        Divides this vector by the given scalar. (= vector/scalar).
        Parameters:
        scalar - the given scalar.
        Returns:
        a new vector with the result of the operation.

      • divideFrom

        DoubleVector divideFrom(double scalar)
        Divides the given scalar by this vector. (= scalar/vector).
        Parameters:
        scalar - the given scalar.
        Returns:
        a new vector with the result of the operation.

      • pow

        DoubleVector pow(int x)
        Powers this vector by the given amount. (=vector^x).
        Parameters:
        x - the given exponent.
        Returns:
        a new vector with the result of the operation.

      • abs

        DoubleVector abs()
        Absolutes the vector at each element.
        Returns:
        a new vector that does not contain negative values anymore.

      • sqrt

        DoubleVector sqrt()
        Square-roots each element.
        Returns:
        a new vector.

      • sum

        double sum()
        Returns:
        the sum of all elements in this vector.

      • dotUnsafe

        double dotUnsafe(DoubleVector vector)
        Calculates the dot product between this vector and the given vector.
        Parameters:
        vector - the given vector.
        Returns:
        the dot product as a double.

      • dot

        double dot(DoubleVector vector)
        Validates the input and calculates the dot product between this vector and the given vector.
        Parameters:
        vector - the given vector.
        Returns:
        the dot product as a double.

      • slice

        DoubleVector slice(int length)
        Validates the input and slices this vector from index 0 to the given length.
        Parameters:
        length - must be > 0 and smaller than the dimension of the vector.
        Returns:
        a new vector that is only length long.

      • sliceUnsafe

        DoubleVector sliceUnsafe(int length)
        Slices this vector from index 0 to the given length.
        Parameters:
        length - must be > 0 and smaller than the dimension of the vector.
        Returns:
        a new vector that is only length long.

      • slice

        DoubleVector slice(int start,
                 int end)
        Validates the input and then slices this vector from start to end, both are INCLUSIVE. For example vec = [0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5], vec.slice(2, 5) = [2, 3, 4, 5].
        Parameters:
        start - must be >= 0 and smaller than the dimension of the vector
        end - must be >= 0 and smaller than the dimension of the vector. This must be greater than or equal to the start.
        Returns:
        a new vector that is only (length) long.

      • sliceUnsafe

        DoubleVector sliceUnsafe(int start,
                       int end)
        Slices this vector from start to end, both are INCLUSIVE. For example vec = [0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5], vec.slice(2, 5) = [2, 3, 4, 5].
        Parameters:
        start - must be >= 0 and smaller than the dimension of the vector
        end - must be >= 0 and smaller than the dimension of the vector. This must be greater than or equal to the start.
        Returns:
        a new vector that is only (length) long.

      • max

        double max()
        Returns:
        the maximum element value in this vector.

      • min

        double min()
        Returns:
        the minimum element value in this vector.

      • toArray

        double[] toArray()
        Returns:
        an array representation of this vector.

      • deepCopy

        DoubleVector deepCopy()
        Returns:
        a fresh new copy of this vector, copies all elements to a new vector. (Does not reuse references or stuff).

      • iterateNonDefault

        Iterator<DoubleVector.DoubleVectorElement> iterateNonDefault()
        Returns:
        an iterator that only iterates over non default elements.

      • iterate

        Iterator<DoubleVector.DoubleVectorElement> iterate()
        Returns:
        an iterator that iterates over all elements.

      • isSparse

        boolean isSparse()
        Return whether the vector is a sparse vector.
        Returns:
        true if this instance is a sparse vector. Smarter and faster than instanceof.

      • isNamed

        boolean isNamed()
        Return whether the vector is a named vector.
        Returns:
        true if this instance is a named vector.Smarter and faster than instanceof.

      • getName

        String getName()
        Get the name of the vector.
        Returns:
        If this vector is a named instance, this will return its name. Or null if this is not a named instance.
